textos_fuente.text: Gainesville Florida's Tom Petty Weekend @ Heartwood Soundstage | FAQ Page Home Lineup Schedule Experience Contact Tom Petty Weekend Lineup Schedule Experience F.A.Q. Contact Buy Pass Frequently Asked Questions When : October 17-19th, 2019 Where : Heartwood Soundstage - Gainesville, FL Why : To honor the music and life of Tom Petty Iâve never been to Tom Petty Weekend. What can I expect? Expect a unique three day indoor/outdoor festival designed to honor Tom in his hometown. The location of the festival (Heartwood Soundstage) has a warm and friendly park-like atmosphere with a friendly attendees from across the country. Heartwoodâs two stages have a capacity of 3500, and features an inside stage that is one the finest performing soundstageâs in the country. What kind of weather should we expect? Traditionally, October weather is wonderful. Highs generally are in the low 80âs, with lows in the upper 60âs. With todayâs unpredictable weather, one should be prepared for the worse case scenarios, from highs in the 90âs (possible, but not likely), to really cool weather (not likely). Sunscreen and a hat is strongly recommended, and itâs best to drink lots of water. Will there be food and drink for sale? There will be a number of high quality food trucks offering many varieties of food at the festival. In addition, we will be serving reasonably priced wine and beer, including this years version of Among The Wildflowers beer from one of four craft breweries in town, Swamphead Brewery. Is there seating? Attendees are encouraged to bring their own lawn chairs. While there is seating in the inside soundstage, attendees are cycled though after each performance during setup / breakdown. Where do I get my Gold / Gold Plus Pass? All passes will be available for pick up at the festival entrance during normal festival hours. Can I get a refund? Refunds are available until 30 days before festival. If you need a refund please contact us via our form, email or phone number. Can I bring a cooler? No, Coolers are not allowed, with an exception for parents of young children. Those coolers will be searched. Is there other Tom Petty related activities on that weekend? In addition to the Tom Petty Weekend festival from Thursday to Saturday, there is a fan organized picnic planned at Tom Petty Park on Sunday the 20th, as well as an unveiling of a new Florida State Historical Marker honoring Tom Petty. On the 19th and 20th, Tom Petty Birthday Bash, a local festival honoring Tom, will take place at Depot Park. parking Please be careful to not park in no parking areas, tow trucks will be removing those parked in an unlawful area. We strongly recommend that you consider Uber or Lyft for your travel to and from the festival. Free Parking Spots We have put together a map of both paid as well as free parking spots within a "reasonable walking distance". Again we advise that you travel via Uber or Lyft when possible Tom Petty Weekend FAQ Privacy Terms & Conditions Contact × Thanks for your message! × Please, fill in required fields. × An error occurred while sending data :(

Staff & Board of Directors - Diamond Head Theatre Skip to content Box Office: (808) 733-0274 | Business Office: (808) 733-0277 Facebook Instagram YouTube LinkedIn Email Search for: Shows & Tickets Buy Tickets Season Subscriptions Seat Map Show Archive Subscriber Login Donate Annual Giving Capital Campaign Producer’s Club Sponsorship ‘Ilima Awards Auditions Show Auditions Shooting Stars Classes Year-Round Classes Summer Musical Theatre Experience Shooting Stars Instructors Scholarships About Staff & Board of Directors Instructors Volunteer Rentals News Show Archive Your New Theatre Theatrical Arts Building Make a Gift Sponsor a Seat Photos News Capital Campaign Donors Contact BUY TICKETS Staff & Board of Directors Jacque Vaughn 2025-07-23T06:29:51-10:00 STAFF & BOARD OF DIRECTORS We bring the magic of theatre to all Trevor Tamashiro, Executive Director Trevor joined Diamond Head Theatre as Executive Director in April 2023. Born and raised in Hawaii, and a graduate of Punahou School, he brings nearly 20 years of experience in nonprofit executive leadership. Trevor started his journey in New York City working for Broadway Dance Center. Other positions include: Chief Advancement Officer of The Diller-Quaile School of Music; Deputy Director of Saratoga International Theater Institute; and Deputy/Program Director for The Drama League of New York. Trevor is a member of the Association of Fundraising Professionals and is a Certified Fund Raising Executive (CFRE). He holds a degree in Theatre Arts from University of Miami, a Master of Business Administration degree from Pace University, and a Master of Science degree in Nonprofit Management from Columbia University. John Rampage, Artistic Director John Rampage is a performer, actor, choreographer, and director who has served as Diamond Head Theatre’s Artistic Director since 1995. He is the creative mastermind behind all of the theatre’s productions and programs, overseeing the curation of two or more shows each season and selects directors, musical directors, and set designers. His relationship with the theatre began in 1975 where he performed as Tommy Gilas in the 1975 production of Music Man. In the 1980s, Rampage danced and sang his way across the U.S. and Europe and returned in 1991 as choreographer of Evita. More than 120 productions have been shared with the community under his oversight. A 47-time Po‘okela Award winner for excellence in the theatre, John is also the recipient of the Hawaii State Theatre Council 2006 Pierre Bowman Award.
